albsavoia wrote:

> I have been invited to contribute an article for a book that covers
> examples of beautiful code (those of you who have been programming for
> quite a while might remember the great book "Programming Pearls" -
> this is along the same lines.) The "catch" is that I have to
> contribute testing-related examples - in other words: beautiful test
> code.
> 
> I already have some ideas of what to cover, but I thought some of the
> people in this group might have some examples of tests that they
> consider particularly "beautiful" or clever in their approach.

I am proud of Contract Tests combined with Interaction Tests to test 
things like controllers in a J2EE application (or whatever they're 
called these days). I think it's beautiful the way I can drive the 
design of both the View and Model by test-driving the Controllers. I 
think the corresponding tests are very nice. If you'd like specific 
examples, I can try to cook a few up from a current project I use in 
tutorials. Contact me directly--me at jbrains dot ca--if you'd like to 
see more.

Take care.
